page.title: 11HUMBER GROWERS-PEST CONTROL
page.content: In 1976 Humber Growers Marketing Organisation set up (21) small glasshouses to mass_rear natural enemies to control Glasshouse Whitefly and Red Spider Mite. The unit produces a parasitic wasp Encatsia formose for Whitefly control and a predatory mite Phytoseiulus persimilis for Red Spider. The technique is highly effective reducing Humber Growers reliance on pesticides to virtually nil. One problem with biological control is when pesticides are removed minor pests become major problems. Our problem was Thrips tabacci, now successfully controlled with a mixture of Polybutene and Deltamethrin sprayed to the ground, not on the crop, since Thrips pupate on the floor. The future philosophy is integrated control using chemical and biological weapons to achieve an ecological pest control.
